options.label: Amniotic Fluid Infection Sequence

report.value: INFLAMMATION CHARACTERISTIC OF AMNIOTIC FLUID INFECTION

options.name: 8b822665-f9c9-435e-afff-0cc060f97300
options.description: Staging and grading criteria from <a href="https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/14708737/">Redline RW, Faye-Petersen O, Heller D, et al. Amniotic infection syndrome: nosology and reproducibility of placental reaction patterns. Pediatr Dev Pathol. 2003;6(5):435-448.

options.label: (1) Early
options.name: 031213bf-18b2-47e5-a980-c92429712f97

images.title: Stage 1 Early
images.description: Neutrophils (arrow) are present in the subchorionic fibrin adjacent to the intervillous space.

options.description: Acute subchorionitis or chorionitis: Neutrophils in subchorionic fibrin and/or membrane trophoblast

options.label: (2) Intermediate
options.name: 7a562d51-fb19-422d-b13f-5b38d2934c48

images.title: Stage 2 Intermediate
images.description: Neutrophils are present in the chorionic and amnionic regions of the placental membranes.

options.description: Acute chorioamnionitis: Diffuse-patchy PMN in the fibrous chorion and/or amnion

options.label: (3) Advanced
options.name: 3569cdc9-e5d8-4ec1-acfe-437c7f2713d4

images.title: Stage 3 Advanced
images.description: Confluent neutrophils present throughout the placental membranes with associated amnion basement membrane thickening and amniocyte necrosis.

options.description: Necrotizing chorioamnionitis: PMN karyorrhexis, amniocyte necrosis, and/or amnion basement membrane thickening/hypereosinophilia

options.label: (1) Mild-Moderate
options.name: dd989b25-5556-4e63-9286-7690b956817c
options.description: No special terminology required: Not severe as defined below

options.label: (2) Severe
options.name: 748c659c-ea45-42c0-8f01-fb7717b70746

images.title: Severe
images.description: Severe acute chorioamnionitis with formation of confluent neutrophil collections (i.e. microabscesses).

options.description: Severe acute chorioamnionitis or with subchorionic microabscesses: Confluemnt PMN (≥10 × 20 cells in extent) between chorion and decidua; ≥3 isolated foci or continuous band Diffuse-patchy PMN in the fibrous chorion and/or amnion

options.label: (1) Early
options.name: 8d1bbb1d-435c-4612-9777-391758591e11

images.title: Grade 1 Early
images.description: Acute chorionic vasculitis: Within the chorionic plate, neutrophils (arrow) are in transit from the chorionic plate vessel towards the amniotic surface at the top of the photo.

images.title: Grade 1 Early
images.description: Umbilical phlebitis: Within the umbilical cord neutrophils (arrow) travel through the vessel wall towards Wharton’s jelly.

options.description: With chorionic vasculitis or umbilical phlebitis: Intramural PMN-chorionic vessels and/or umbilical vein

options.label: (2) Intermediate
options.name: 5a89b6e1-6317-4b27-a93b-93b8728c6039

images.title: Grade 2 Intermediate
images.description: Umbilical arteritis: Neutrophils infiltrate the wall of an umbilical artery.

options.description: With umbilical vasculitis (one or two arteries ± umbilical vein) or umbilical panvasculitis (all vessels): Intramural PMN-umbilical artery or arteries (± umbilical vein)

options.label: (3) Advanced

value.replaceStr: 3 (ADVANCED, NECROTIZING FUNISITIS OR CONCENTRIC UMBILICAL PERIVASCULITIS)

options.name: acd227c3-a0b9-4554-b733-421389103b74

images.title: Grade 3 Advanced
images.description: Necrotizing funisitis: Neutrophils have traversed passed the vessel wall and are found in Wharton jelly along with necrotic debris and sometimes calcium (not shown here).

options.description: With (subacute) necrotizing funisitis or with concentric umbilical perivasculitis: PMN ± associated debris in concentric bands-rings-halos around one or more umbilical vessels

options.label: (1) Mild-Moderate
options.name: f06b3d2c-04c3-414c-97ab-fec848995ea5
options.description: No special terminology required: Not severe as defined below

options.label: (2) Severe
options.name: 7fdafe26-e978-4e03-90c5-c2755966f86a

images.title: Severe
images.description: Near confluent bands of neutrophilic infiltrate within an umbilical vessel with degermation of the vascular smooth muscle cells in the vessel wall.

options.description: With a severe fetal inflammatory response or with intense chorionic (umbilical) vasculitis: Confluemnt PMN (≥10 × 20 cells in extent) between chorion and decidua; ≥3 isolated foci or continuous band Near confluent intramural PMN in chorionic and/or umbilical vessels with attenuation/degeneration of vascular smooth muscle cells

options.label: Subchorionitis, consistent with early or mild amniotic fluid infection

report.value: SUBCHORIONITIS, CONSISTENT WITH EARLY OR MILD AMNIOTIC FLUID INFECTION

options.name: a9a11681-4243-4367-a100-c7c6ee3c6577

options.label: Inflammatory abruption: marginal, retroplacental, or subchorionic bleeding

report.value: INFLAMMATORY ABRUPTION: [### MARGINAL / RETROPLACENTAL / SUBCHORIONIC ###] BLEEDING

options.name: e7240ee0-6fd5-430b-bb17-f79deef79196

options.label: Amniotic fluid infection associated with extreme preterm delivery in mid-gestation raises concern for cervical incompetence. Clinical correlation may be helpful in this regard.

report.value: Amniotic fluid infection associated with extreme preterm delivery in mid-gestation raises concern for cervical incompetence. Clinical correlation may be helpful in this regard.

options.name: 77306b6e-4d62-4c72-b1ee-3a3e5461b251

options.label: Findings suggestive of maternal vascular malperfusion

report.value: FINDINGS SUGGESTIVE OF MATERNAL VASCULAR MALPERFUSION

options.name: 10588a6e-5df9-4d1f-bc1f-0244622209b9

options.label: Placental infarct: specify number, percent of disc volume, recent or remote

report.value: PLACENTAL INFARCT: [### NUMBER, X% OF DISC VOLUME, RECENT OR REMOTE ###]

options.name: a0fce4ae-f134-4337-bd10-d7585a768d3d

options.label: Retroplacental hemorrhage: Specify size, recent or remote

report.value: RETROPLACENTAL HEMATOMA [### SIZE, RECENT OR REMOTE ###]

options.name: f68b9926-6769-46d5-a4b7-558682446524

info.title: Decidual Arteriopathy, mild: non-transformation of spiral arterioles

images.title: Decidual arteriopathy
images.description: Mural hypertrophy of decidual maternal vessels is demonstrated in the membrane role, but is often best seen in the basal plate.

images.title: Acute atherosis
images.description: Lipid-laden macrophages are present within the vessel wall in conjunction with fibrinoid necrosis.

images.title: Fibrinoid necrosis
images.description: A small maternal artery demonstrating necrotic wall changes.
Defined as aggregates of >5 syncytiotrophoblastic nuclei projecting from the villous surface of a villi. Some of the multiple syncytial knots are denoted by arrows.

options.label: Pathologic features of maternal vascular malperfusion can be seen in maternal conditions with a component of vascular disease (e.g. pre-eclampsia, hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes and low platelets HELLP [hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes and low platelets] syndrome, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and autoimmunity). There may be increased risk for recurrence in future pregnancies.

report.value: Pathologic features of maternal vascular malperfusion can be seen in maternal conditions with a component of vascular disease (e.g. pre-eclampsia, HELLP [hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes and low platelets] syndrome, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, and autoimmunity). There can be increased risk for recurrence in future pregnancies.

options.name: 0dec1257-5ffb-45d0-958d-24691ea3843e

options.label: Fetal Vascular Malperfusion
options.name: 90dabfc7-5850-4564-9550-09f58e43621b
options.description: The lesions described under this umbrella of FVM are likely to be due to obstruction in fetal blood flow that could result from a number of conditions (eg, umbilical cord lesions, hypercoagulability, complications of fetal cardiac dysfunction, such as hypoxia, etc.).

options.label: Findings of fetal vascular malperfusion
options.description: Fetal vascular malperfusion may be utilized as a general header or subdivided as segmental and global. It is of note that global fetal vascular malperfusion is very rare.
options.name: 7c8ef209-efe1-42a0-b9ee-4c57d8b45462

options.label: Findings of segmental fetal vascular malperfusion

info.title: Findings of segmental fetal vascular malperfusion

description.description:
Findings include:
  • Large fetal vessel vascular thrombi
  • Focal stem (or chorionic) vessel obliteration
  • Intermediate to large Villous-stromal karyorrhexis
  • Intermediate to large Avascular villi

options.description: Segmental fetal vascular indicates thrombotic occlusion of chorionic or stem villous vessels, or stem vessel obliteration—although the distribution of the lesions is segmental, the thrombus or obstruction would be expected to result in complete obstruction to the villi downstream.

report.value: FINDINGS OF SEGMENTAL FETAL VASCULAR MALPERFUSION

options.name: 82a903fc-6679-4b62-90e9-ec9083afe6ee

options.label: Findings of global (partial) fetal vascular malperfusion
options.description: Global (partial) fetal vascular is very rare, and indicates partially obstructed umbilical blood flow with venous ectasia, intramural fibrin deposition in large vessels, and/or small foci (<5 villi per focus) of avascular or karyorrhectic villi—the obstruction is partial or intermittent, but the lesions can be distributed over much of the placenta.

report.value: FINDINGS OF GLOBAL FETAL VASCULAR MALPERFUSION

info.title: Findings of global (complete) fetal vascular malperfusion

description.description:
Findings include:
  • Large fetal vessel intramural fibrin deposition
  • Vascular ectasia
  • Delayed villous maturation
  • Patchy villous edema
  • Villous-stromal karyorrhexis foci, small foci (2-4 terminal villi)
  • Avascular villi foci, small foci (2-4 terminal villi)

options.name: 4174243b-ec19-4337-a666-e384f9b6a6cb

options.label: Grading
options.name: 3a7680c2-a606-4408-8ebb-64ff682028b9
options.description: High-grade fetal vascular malperfusion is manifest by the finding of more than one focus of avascular villi (a cumulative assessment of ≥45 avascular villi over 3 sections examined or an average of >15 villi per section) with or without thrombus, or 2 or more occlusive or nonocclusive thrombi in chorionic plate or major stem villi, or multiple nonocclusive thrombi.

options.label: Clear
options.name: 4a0d1cae-006b-4f0e-94ae-711045454191
options.description: There is no defined low-grade fetal vascular malperfusion.

options.label: Narrow umbilical cord diameter (<0.8 cm)
options.name: bf5a8416-5e8e-404e-8b54-d10f20509a62
options.description: Note that this only applies to term placentas

options.label: Clinical history of umbilical cord entanglement (e.g. nucal, body cord)

report.value: CLINICAL HISTORY OF UMBILICAL CORD ENTAGLMENT

options.name: fc433521-d362-427e-bfa6-1eb13b74a22d

options.label: Clinical history of umbilical cord prolapse

report.value: CLINICAL HISTORY OF UMBILICAL CORD PROLAPSE

options.name: 5a7592e5-59cf-45d3-9492-a38d2aa37fbc

options.label: Clinical history of umbilical cord compression (e.g. oligohydramios, submucosal leiyomyoma)

report.value: CLINICAL HISTORY OF UMBILICAL CORD COMPRESSION

options.name: 60264162-f8d2-4ce4-ac51-0ce0cee7c9e6

options.label: Large fetal vessel intramural fibrin deposition

report.value: LARGE FETAL VESSEL INTRAMURAL FIBRIN DEPOSITION

options.name: a57ef223-e1b4-4329-a9d1-87f7dcd92e03

report.value: FOCAL STEM OR CHORIONIC VESSEL OBLITERATION

options.label: Avascular villi foci, small foci (3 or more sets of 2-4 terminal villi)

report.value: The clinical significance of small avascular villi is uncertian.

options.name: 6c12079d-8681-455b-828b-ea42aa704be5
options.description: Comment: The clinical significance of small avascular villi is uncertian.

options.label: Umbilical cord obstruction is a common cause of fetal vascular malperfusion, though, the differential diagnosis includes fetal related heritable hypercoagulability, hyperviscosity, and cardiac insufficiency. The differential diagnosis in stillbirth placentas includes passive involutional changes in fetal vessels associated with prolonged demise before delivery. In contrast to antemortem fetal vascular thrombosis, postmortem involution is temporally uniform and global, a pattern that is not present in this case.

report.value: Umbilical cord obstruction is a common cause of fetal vascular malperfusion, though, the differential diagnosis includes fetal related heritable hypercoagulability, hyperviscosity, and cardiac insufficiency. The differential diagnosis in stillbirth placentas includes passive involutional changes in fetal vessels associated with prolonged demise before delivery. In contrast to antemortem fetal vascular thrombosis, postmortem involution is temporally uniform and global, a pattern that is not present in this case.

options.name: 2bc8f27b-af19-483f-a381-8c3000bc121c

options.label: The differential diagnosis in stillbirth placentas includes passive involutional changes in fetal vessels associated with prolonged demise before delivery. In contrast to antemortem fetal vascular thrombosis, postmortem involution is temporally uniform and global, a pattern that is not present in this case.

report.value: The differential diagnosis in stillbirth placentas includes passive involutional changes in fetal vessels associated with prolonged demise before delivery. In contrast to antemortem fetal vascular thrombosis, postmortem involution is temporally uniform and global, a pattern that is not present in this case.

options.name: 7e920994-ee3c-40db-9d78-15fbafd8932b

options.label: Low Grade
options.name: 0e335fc4-1aa7-4a9e-bee6-e84e7d95bcf0
options.description: Low grade is defined as fewer than 10 contiguous villi affected by vilitis in any give foci.

options.label: Unifocal

report.value: A single focus of low-grade chronic villitis is termed "ungradeable - possible low-grade" by the 2016 Amsterdam criteria.

options.name: 03a79313-4686-4815-9fdf-cdef782ffc9d
options.description: Only one focus of vilitis.

options.label: Focal
options.name: 5151c5c1-b568-4da8-b21a-e4ed9045aefb
options.description: Vilitis present in at least 2 foci on 1 slide.

options.label: Multifocal
options.name: 304f9908-c8d8-4843-82a9-60c6db39dc24
options.description: Vilitis present on 2 slides.

options.label: High Grade
options.name: 0a4b096c-4085-4bed-8817-3dc1433eb699
options.description: High grade is defined as any focus of villitis affecting more than 10 contiguous villi.

options.label: Unifocal

report.value: A single focus of high-grade chronic villitis is termed "ungradeable - possible high-grade" by the 2016 Amsterdam criteria.

options.name: 23ad9a1b-a22b-43f9-b402-9687a7c43eee
options.description: Only one focus of vilitis.

options.label: Patchy
options.name: 02fc6d04-7e69-4bd5-a9a3-cc6528be4fcd
options.description: Vilitis present on 2 slides.

options.label: Multifocal
options.name: d8f27665-c8b7-4915-b791-d30cc97ca9db
options.description: Greater than 30% of all distal villi involved by vilitis.

options.label: Muscular-walled vessels damaged by inflammatory cells
options.name: 15ab5bc7-44a4-4ca1-b660-a91ed65b4db8

report.value: An immunohistochemical stain for cytomegalovirus (CMV) is negative.
The placenta is involved by cytomegalovirus (CMV) as confirmed by immunohistochemical staining.

options.label: These findings are consistent with villitis of unknown etiology (VUE); if infection is suspected clinically, additional stains can be performed.
options.name: 5efea986-3e3f-439b-afb3-4748cfc3954a

report.value: These findings are consistent with villitis of unknown etiology (VUE); if infection is suspected clinically, additional stains can be performed.
FEATURES SUGGESTIVE OF PRIOR RETROPLACENTAL HEMORRHAGE

options.label: Acute abruption suspected clinically
options.name: d486cbd7-ea56-418d-b9b6-c7e803973bb0
options.description: Select this option if there is no histologic evidence of abruption.

options.label: Retroplacental hemorrhage is the pathologic correlate of chronic abruption, and is associated with preterm delivery, chronic/persistent vaginal bleeding, and oligohydramnios. The etiology is unknown, but is likely due to premature marginal placental separation. There is no apparent risk for recurrence in future pregnancies.
options.name: ab7f552c-1728-4eb9-97e9-c6447fb98db5

report.value: Retroplacental hemorrhage is the pathologic correlate of chronic abruption, and is associated with preterm delivery, chronic/persistent vaginal bleeding, and oligohydramnios. The etiology is unknown, but is likely due to premature marginal placental separation. There is no apparent risk for recurrence in future pregnancies.

options.label: We do not see gross or microscopic features of acute abruption. However, pathologic findings are not always present, and this is best a clinical diagnosis.
options.name: 100be539-53b6-4a39-9ba7-047eb9021ccc

report.value: We do not see gross or microscopic features of acute abruption. However, pathologic findings are not always present, and this is best a clinical diagnosis.
SARS-COV IMMUNOHISTOCHEMISTRY AND SARS-COV2 IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION NEGATIVE (SEE COMMENT)

options.name: ff0eca95-4e41-4e4c-a930-7ff2426e79b3
options.label: Immunohistochemical stains for SARS-CoV nucleocapsid protein (sinobiological T62, polyclonal) and ISH for SARS-CoV2 spike protein (RNAscope) are negative.

report.value: Immunohistochemical stains for SARS-CoV nucleocapsid protein (sinobiological T62, polyclonal) and ISH for SARS-CoV2 spike protein (RNAscope) are negative.

options.label: Histologic sections of the placenta show post-mortem fetal vascular involutional changes consistent with a demise to delivery interval of greater than 2 days but less than 2 weeks. There are no histopathological features of infection, villitis, abruption, fetal-maternal hemorrhage, or fetal/maternal vascular malperfusion. Overall, we do not see a specific etiology for the demise based on examination of the placental sections.
options.name: 2d8ae662-8517-422e-8674-92a683f2c8ed

report.value: Histologic sections of the placenta show post-mortem fetal vascular involutional changes consistent with a demise to delivery interval of greater than 2 days but less than 2 weeks. There are no histopathological features of infection, villitis, abruption, fetal-maternal hemorrhage, or fetal/maternal vascular malperfusion. Overall, we do not see a specific etiology for the demise based on examination of the placental sections.

options.label: Fetal chorionic plate vessel with Eosinophilic/T-cell vasculitis
options.name: bf750200-8802-49e1-95ca-a6b2e3d9c097
options.description: (Generates comment.)

report.value: FETAL CHORIONIC PLATE VESSEL WITH EOSINOPHILIC T-CELL VASCULITIS (SEE COMMENT)

Histologic sections demonstrate eosinophilic/T-cell vasculitis in one chorionic plate fetal vessel, which is characterized by a mixed inflammatory infiltrate that includes eosinophils. Eosinophilic/T-cell vasculitis probably reflects a delayed hypersensitivity response to an idiopathic stimulus; there are no clearly defined clinical associations, and the clinical significance is unknown.
